snippet: Spanish health officials began to explain Wednesday how an auxiliary nurse became the first Ebola case in Western Europe.
abstract: Spanish health officials explain how auxiliary nurse Maria Teresa Romero Ramos became the first Ebola case in Western Europe, saying that it was likely she became infected when she touched her face with the gloves she had worn while tending to a Spanish missionary with Ebola at a Madrid hospital.
lead_paragraph: Spanish health officials began to explain Wednesday how an auxiliary nurse became the first Ebola case in Western Europe.

headline.main: Officials Cite Error With Gloves in Spanish Case of Ebola
headline.print_headline: Spanish Case May Be Tied to Mistake With Gloves
